intro: Sphaeralcea incana var. oblongifolia, commonly known as the woolly globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its hairy, silver-gray foliage and clusters of yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Its unique appearance and drought tolerance make it a notable species in arid landscapes.
